dt: {bc}the sixth tone of a C-major scale
{bc}a graphic device for reproducing the letter {it}a{/it}
{bc}one designated {it}a{/it} especially as the first in order or class
{bc}a grade rating a student's work as superior in quality
{bc}one graded or rated with an A
{bc}the one of the four ABO blood groups characterized by the presence of antigens designated by the letter A and by the presence of antibodies against the antigens present in the B blood group

shortdef: the 1st letter of the English alphabet
a graphic representation of this letter
a speech counterpart of orthographic a

dt: used as a function word before singular nouns when the referent is unspecified
and before number collectives and some numbers
used as a function word before a singular noun followed by a restrictive modifier

dt.t: {it}a{/it} person who is sick can't work

dt: used as a function word before a mass noun to denote a particular type or instance
used as a function word before a proper noun representing an example or type

dt.t: the attractions of {it}a{/it} Boston or {it}a{/it} Cleveland

dt: used as a function word before a proper noun to indicate limited knowledge about the referent

dt.t: {it}a{/it} Mr. Smith called to inquire about the job

dt: used as a function word before a proper noun to distinguish the condition of the referent from a usual, former, or hypothetical condition

dt.t: {it}a{/it} triumphant Ms. Jones greeted her supporters

dt: used before the name of a day of the week to refer to one occurrence of it

dt.t: Christmas falls on {wi}a{/wi} Tuesday this year.

dt: used before the name of a person (such as a famous artist) when the name is being used to refer to something (such as a painting) created by that person
used before a family name to show that someone is a member of that family

dt.t: To be {wi}a{/wi} Kennedy is to lead two lives …

dt: used as a function word with nouns to form adverbial phrases of quantity, amount, or degree

pt: In speech and writing {it}a{/it} is used before a consonant sound.
Before a vowel sound {it}an{/it} is usual
but especially in speech {it}a{/it} is used occasionally, more often in some dialects than in others.
Before a consonant sound represented by a vowel letter {it}a{/it} is usual
but {it}an{/it} also occurs though less frequently now than formerly.
Before unstressed or weakly stressed syllables with initial {it}h{/it} both {it}a{/it} and {it}an{/it} are used in writing.
In the King James Version of the Old Testament and occasionally in writing and speech {it}an{/it} is used before {it}h{/it} in a stressed syllable.

pt.t: children are {it}an{/it} heritage of the Lord

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}ān{/it} one {ma}{mat|one|}{/ma}
shortdef: —used as a function word before singular nouns when the referent is unspecified and before number collectives and some numbers
—used as a function word before a singular noun followed by a restrictive modifier

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}a-, an, on{/it}

dt.t: There are a lot {wi}a{/wi} stairs, but the view at the top is absolutely beautiful.

dt: often attached to the preceding word

dt.t: But I did kind{wi}a{/wi} sort{wi}a{/wi} secretly hope to one day be interviewed from Oprah Winfrey's yoga nook.
That's a whole lott{wi}a{/wi} {gloss}=lot of{/gloss} hypothesizin' without a whole lott{wi}a{/wi} science.

shortdef: of —often attached to the preceding word

dt.t: I might {it}a{/it} had husbands afore now …
Poor Sir William! never shall I forget how he looked whin my lady and he parted. I could {wi}a{/wi} tould the reason, but I'd {wi}a{/wi} cut my tongue out first.

dt: {it}a-{/it} before consonants other than {it}h{/it} and sometimes even before {it}h, an-{/it} before vowels and usually before {it}h{/it}

shortdef: not : without —a- before consonants other than h and sometimes even before h, an- before vowels and usually before h

et: perhaps from {it}-a-{/it} in ring compounds such as {et_link|thiazole|thiazole} (in which {it}-a-{/it} is the initial of {et_link|azole|azole})
shortdef: replacing carbon especially in a ring
